definitions.definition: a litigant or party that is making an appeal in court
examples: The appellant made her submissions to the court.

definitions.definition: One who makes an earnest entreaty of any kind.
One who challenges another to single combat .
One of the clergy in the Jansenist controversy who rejected the bull Unigenitus issued in 1713, appealing to a pope "better informed", or to a general council.

main_definition: ( law ) a litigant or party that is making an appeal in court
secondary_definitions: One who makes an earnest entreaty of any kind.
( obsolete ) One who challenges another to single combat .
( historical ) One of the clergy in the Jansenist controversy who rejected the bull Unigenitus issued in 1713, appealing to a pope "better informed", or to a general council.
